text: What determines whether or not my email template will require that I include `{{ standard_footer_includes }}` and `{{ standard_header_includes }}`? I have some HTML + HubL templates where it considers it an error when it’s not included, but others don’t. And I can’t tell what the difference is.

Separate question. So apparently “Smart Rules” are available in the Drag-and-Drop builder to allow us to show different content based on contact list membership? But this functionality does not extend to custom templates? :exploding_head:

I’m running into an issue with personalization tokens in a workflow email, and I was wondering if anyone has had similar issues or experiences.

I’ve got an email that uses a variety of personalization tokens, most of them being `contact` properties and one being a (custom) `company` property. When previewing or sending a test email as a contact, or when performing a manual send, all of the personalization tokens fill just fine. However, when sending the email from an automation, the `company` property always returns a null value.

Has anyone had an issue with `company` personalization tokens not filling in automated/workflow-triggered emails, or have any advice as to how I might be able to get it to fill? Thanks!
